April 24 at 5:49 PM ·

Happy opening night Gateway's Drowsy Chaperone!

Tonight would have been opening night for Gateway High School’s musical, The Drowsy Chaperone! Sadly, these talented kids won’t get to perform this year. I’m especially sad for my seniors who do not get to experience their last opening night jitters...last alma mater circle... last costume parade ... last musical banquet... their last final bow! Musical is such an important part of their high school experience and my heart is hurting for them! 😢💔

Here are a few dance rehearsal videos we took throughout the month we got to be together. A lot of these videos are from only a couple rehearsals in ... and the kids look so good! They worked so hard at each practice and I’m forever grateful to have spent this short amount of time together!

“Don’t be lousy... get Drowsy!” 😘

Last week, the AIM department partnered with the World Languages department to host the first world languages competition in the Pittsburgh region since 2006.

10 teams from the region came to Gateway High School to test their language skills and knowledge. Four challenging rounds consisted of: written questions, oral responses, Latin derivatives, and a culture section.

Students were presented with snacks from around the world during their break and got to play International Bingo to wrap up the day. Be sure to congratulate these students and the World Languages department on job well done!

The winning teams were as follows: French - 1st place team -Gateway (Hera Mukhtar & Kyah Russell), Spanish - 3rd place team Gateway A (Dylan Baxter, Micah Symons, Holly Minnich, Madylin Hout, and Erika Wilson).

A special congratulations to the members of the GHS Academic Challenge team for earning first place at the ESSPA Academic Challenge competition hosted by West Mifflin HS. Tuesday's competition brought 19 teams from the region to compete in general trivia, including science, math, social
studies, art, and current events.

A-Team members were: Tad Horomanski
(1st place individual), Bennett Galia (2nd place individual), Micah Symons (4th place individual), Meryl Wiratmo (4th place individual), Liz Timple, and B-Team member Ben Meshanko earned a 4th place individual award. Please be sure to congratulate these student scholars on a job well done! The A-team will now move onto the Allegheny County championships with hopes of making the PA State Academic Championships. This is the fourth time in the last five years Gateway has won the Academic Challenge competition and earned a trip to the PA State Academic Championships.
